intro: Hieracium aechmetes, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. It has yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets, and its leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures. Hieracium aechmetes is often considered a weed but plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
